slides.title: Rate table definition
slides.originalNotes:
Rate table definition
If you have a rate table, you need to define the table contents, which is accomplished by the rate table definition option. Using the same DriverAgeFactor table, this example shows the rate table definition in PolicyCenter.

Parameter sets determines the information available for setting the default argument sources in the rate table definition.

slides.title: Rate book lifecycle
slides.ocrText:
| Rate book lifecycle

Kalani @

Rating Analyst

)

OK, so what does the rate
book life cycle look like?

| Rate books progress though
a lifecycle as they are
created, reviewed, and
approved for use in
production. I'll show you how
this works.

Julia
Implementation
Architect

i

slides.title: Rate book lifecycle and move to production fa
slides.originalNotes:
Rate book lifecycle and move to production
This diagram shows the rate book lifecycle in a single environment Many insurers have multiple environments (development, one or more test/staging environments and production) to better control production changes. However, some insurers may not have separate test and stage environments.

Users can add a new rate book or version to an active rate book which creates the rate book in Draft status. After users have finished making changes, they can promote the rate book status to Stage. Testing may occur in the same development environment; however, insurers often have a separate staging environment for testing. To move the rate book to a testing environment, use the rate book export and import actions in the Rate Book Editor. Exporting a rate book includes all included rate tables and definitions associated with that rate book.

After testing is completed, users can update the rate book status to Approved. An approved rate book is ready to move to productiom Then users can activate the rate book for production use. Upon activation, the rate book status is set to Active and the rate book is available for production policy rating. NOTE: Active rate books cannot be modified.
slides.notes:
Rate book lifecycle and move to production
This diagram shows the rate book lifecycle in a single environment Many insurers have multiple environments (development, one or more test/staging environments and production) to better control production changes. However, some insurers may not have separate test and stage environments.

Users can add a new rate book or version to an active rate book which creates the rate book in Draft status. After users have finished making changes, they can promote the rate book status to Stage. Testing may occur in the same development environment; however, insurers often have a separate staging environment for testing. To move the rate book to a testing environment, use the rate book export and import actions in the Rate Book Editor. Exporting a rate book includes all included rate tables and definitions associated with that rate book.

After testing is completed, users can update the rate book status to Approved. An approved rate book is ready to move to productiom Then users can activate the rate book for production use. Upon activation, the rate book status is set to Active and the rate book is available for production policy rating. NOTE: Active rate books cannot be modified.

slides.title: Rate tables, rate books, and rate routines
slides.originalNotes:
Rate tables, rate books, and rate routines
During rating, the rating engine selects the appropriate rate book edition and rate table version. The rating engine gets costs by executing the rate routines in the rate book.
slides.notes:
Rate tables, rate books, and rate routines
During rating, the rating engine selects the appropriate rate book edition and rate table version. The rating engine gets costs by executing the rate routines in the rate book.

slides.title: Rate table versions
slides.originalNotes:
Rate table versions
When you edit rate table content in a rate book, PolicyCenter creates a new version of that rate table. The rate book includes the new rate table.
slides.notes:
Rate table versions
When you edit rate table content in a rate book, PolicyCenter creates a new version of that rate table. The rate book includes the new rate table.

slides.title: Rate books and rate book editions
slides.originalNotes:
Rate books and rate book editions
Activated rate books cannot be updated to ensure integrity and auditability. When a rate table needs to be changed in an active rate book, a new edition of the rate book must be created. In this example, we are going to see what happens when a rate book is changed.

We start off with the •Edition 1“ rate book that has two rate tables A and B. <Advance the animation>
Next, we create a new edition of our rate book, •Edition 2". Rate table A is unchanged and is included in the "Edition 2" rate book. However, we made a change to rate table B which is now rate table This version of the rate table is included in the new "Edition 2" rate book.

When a new edition ("Edition 2") is created, the user can update the affected rate tables. Updated rate tables are automatically saved in the new edition's rate book. To avoid a proliferation of rate table versions, unchanged rate tables in the new edition ("Edition 2") continue to reference the existing rate table.
slides.notes:

slides.title: Rate book matching
slides.originalNotes:
Rate book matching
Most appropriate ratebook only: When selecting the most appropriate rate book, if an exact match is not found, relax the optional attributes by looking for 'null' occurrences in the optional attributes.

Cascaded lookup: Use cascaded lookup to find matching rate tables and rate routines in a hierarchical list of rate books.
slides.notes:
Rate book matching
Most appropriate ratebook only: When selecting the most appropriate rate book, if an exact match is not found, relax the optional attributes by looking for 'null' occurrences in the optional attributes.

Cascaded lookup: Use cascaded lookup to find matching rate tables and rate routines in a hierarchical list of rate books.
slides.ocrText:
| Rate book matching

« Arating query selects the most appropriate rate book edition, to use for policy
rating

« Rating selects the most appropriate rate book with or without a cascaded lookup

slides.title: Required attributes for rate book candidates
slides.originalNotes:
Required attributes for rate book candidates
Whether or not cascaded lookup is enabled, the required attributes for rate book candidates is the same. Rate as of Date gives the ability to control which rate book is used when multiple books are in effect.
slides.notes:
Required attributes for rate book candidates
Whether or not cascaded lookup is enabled, the required attributes for rate book candidates is the same. Rate as of Date gives the ability to control which rate book is used when multiple books are in effect.

| Required attributes for rate book candidates Gi

• Activation Date: The rate book

| vatic 7
activation date must be earlier than

i [| the policy Rate as of Date

i

• The rate book status setting is set
to Minimum Rating or higher

• Effective/Expiration Dates: The
reference date must be later than
or equal to the rate book’s effective
date, yet earlier than the expiration
date

slides.title: Which rate book (RB) should be used?
slides.originalNotes:
Which rate book (RB) should be used?
The Policy Rate as of Date controls which version of a rate book (RB) to use when there are rate book versions with overlapping effective dates.

First, the submission is rated using rate book Y

All three rate books, X, Y, and Z, are effective on Jan 1, 2017

Base configuration Policy Change uses RB Y because:

Those rates were used originally to rate the policy

Rate as of Date has the original policy's rate date

Which rate book is used can be configured according to insurer requirements. Cascaded lookup is available as a way to find matching rate tables in a hierarchical list of rate books.

slides.title: Demonstration
slides.originalNotes:
Demonstration
Export and import RBs to XML to move RBs from one environment to another without moving the entire database:
RB can have any status except Draft, and
ratebookview permission must be granted.

The user must have the appropriate permission.

The exported or imported XMLincludes the rate book and rate routines associated with the rate book. If a rate book contains rate tables that are referencing (not owned), then the exported XMLcontains links to the rate table content By not duplicating the rate table content, referencing provides an efficient use of memory if the target system contains the rate table content.

You may get a validation warning or errors. If you get any warnings the Export To XML button changes to Continue to Export to XML. If you wish to continue the export with the warning, either continue or fix the warning issue first. If you receive validation errors, then export cannot be continued.

Any development environment should have unique prefix for ids, in line with Guidewire's general recommended practices

•

SS oe Oooo ee Oooo ooOoD

questionData.question: Explain the concept of rate table versions and rate book editions.
questionData.answer:
PolicyCenter creates new rate table versions when you edit a rate table in a rate book.
Active rate books cannot be edited. You must create a new rate book edition to be
able to edit a rate table.

slides.title: Answer
